term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - rotational relaxation time
term.title: rotational relaxation time

item.text: Parameter describing the time-dependence of the tumbling of a molecular entity in a medium of viscosityη as originally defined by Debye, and used by Perrin in the original development of the theories of rotational motion of fluorophores.

notes.item: Related to the rotational correlation time, τc, by ρ = 3τc. Thus, in the case of a spherically emitting species reorienting itself in a homogeneous fluid, ρ = 1/6Dr, with Dr the rotational diffusion coefficient.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 416 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
